Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

Allegation Initial Allegation: While a youth was placed at the facility from

relationship with the youth. Since leaving the facility, the youth and
former staff member, are now in a relationship.
Additional Allegation: Staff used marijuana prior to coming to
work.
Investigation Interviews:
Consultant received the information during a staff interview
regarding another incident.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 4/18/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she was

Youth A reported Staff 1 occasionally worked on her side of the
facility. Youth A reported she did not think Staff 1 was a bad staff,
he just did not know how to be professional with his language.
Youth A reported she never had any personal conversations with
Staff 1 and denied any type of relationship with Staff 1. Youth A
reported a few girls at the facility had “crushes” on Staff 1 however
she reported she did not. Youth A reported no romantic feelings
towards Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 never initiated any
romantic conversations with her, never attempted to get her alone
at the facility, never made any statements or comments that made
her feel uncomfortable and never attempted to contact her when

she left the facility. Youth A reported she has not spoken with
Staff 1 since he was fired from the facility and is not in any
relationship with Staff 1. Youth A reported no concerns of Staff 1
having any inappropriate relationships with any youth at the facility
or any staff.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on 4/29/2025 in

Youth B denied Youth A ever being alone with Staff 3. Youth B

Youth B reported she did not have any further information or
concerns regarding Youth A and any staff at the facility.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation examined allegations that a staff member (Staff 1) at Osceola Youth Center pursued an inappropriate relationship with a resident (Youth A). While the specific allegation of a romantic relationship was not substantiated, the investigation found that Staff 1 was terminated for coming to work under the influence of marijuana, exhibited unprofessional behavior including poor boundaries and inappropriate language, and failed to meet the required ability to perform his duties. Additionally, a separate violation was substantiated because another staff member (Staff 4) failed to report a resident's statement about having sex with Staff 1 in a facility van as required by child protection policy. Overall culpability for the violations lies with both the individual staff members for their misconduct and the facility administration for systemic failures in oversight and reporting.
